clues.text: Fargo, North Dakota was named for a partner in this stagecoach express line
With this state's Moorhead, Fargo forms a metro area of about 180,000
Also known as a plains buffalo, it's the logo & nickname of North Dakota State's athletic teams
This home run slugger's museum has his 1961 Hickok Pro Athlete of the Year Award & a replica of his Yankee locker
This railroad, the NP, built a line that reached Fargo in 1872 & as far as Bismarck a year later
He wrote the script for the 1961 film "The Misfits"
Country legend who wrote & sang "King of the Road"
In a letter to Anais Nin, he wrote, "Was all this so wonderful only because it was brief and stolen?"
In 2000, Georgia's governor appointed this man to fill the seat of deceased U.S. senator Paul Coverdell
He changed the world of comic books with "Batman: The Dark Knight Returns" & "Sin City"
In 1841, crowds gathered on NYC docks to get the (not good) news of the fate of this author's Little Nell
He wrote, "The fish had moved away. It swallowed the woman's limb without chewing"
This author's character Lennie is stroking the hair of Curley's wife when things go wrong
In his "An American Tragedy", Clyde muses that Roberta "could not swim-- could not swim-- could not swim"
Winifred Utley is clubbed dead in "A Season in Purgatory" by this Vanity Fair murder journalist
In 1920, King Alexander of Greece, bitten by a monkey, died of septicemia, also called by this 2-word name
A type of high-tech TV screen shares its name with this straw-colored fluid of the blood
The inherited absence of the blood-clotting agent known as factor VIII leads to this disease
Much of this organ's blood comes from the hepatic artery
O- is the universal donor blood type & we're "positive" that this blood type is the "universal recipient"
Trim off "man" from a word for humanity & you get this 4-letter adjective meaning considerate or gentle
Chop "man" from a term for a band's lead singer & get this word for a place where 2 air masses meet
Snip "man" from a term for a junior or senior in college & get this term for something of high social rank
Take "man" away from a term for a type of nighttime secruity guard & you get this type of timepiece
Bite away "man" from a fancy word for someone fond of his food & get this word for edibles like squash or melons
The Coens were nominated for a 2000 screenwriting Oscar for this film that starred George Clooney
Joel Coen is married to this actress who starred in "Fargo", don'tcha know
This 1987 comedy starred Nicolas Cage & Holly Hunter as baby snatchers
This 1998 effort had Jeff Bridges mistaken for a millionaire of the same name
An early writing effort from Ethan & Joel was 1985's "Crimewave", penned for this man who directed "Spider-Man"
Digging in Jerusalem, Eilat Mazar believes she has found the palace of this 10th century B.C. king
The first ship completely excavated on the sea bed dates from 1200 B.C., this age; the metal was much of its cargo
The Acheulian (Bless me!) tradition of Paleolithic times had as its main tool a "hand" one of these
The 1930s find of huge stone heads brought to light this Mesoamerican people, not to be confused with the Toltecs
The Zhoukoudian excavations in China led to debate to whether this homo erectus knew how to use fire

Things are "O.K." in this Arizona town, where you'll enter its Boot Hill graveyard through a gift shop
In Glen Echo, Maryland, tour the former headquarters of the American branch of this, housed in Clara Barton's home
Sew up your trip to Tennessee by visiting this President's home & tailor shop in Greeneville
In 2006 this battle site celebrated the 225th anniversary of a famous surrender
Learn about Ethan Allen at his last home, a short drive from the University of Vermont in this city
Sarah Weddington was the attorney who successfully argued this landmark Supreme Court case in 1973
The eminent British archaeologist Dorothy Garrod was the first female professor at this British university
After earning a law degree from Trinity College, Mary Robinson became the first woman president of this nation
In 1999 Nancy Mace became the first female graduate of this South Carolina Military Academy
A former actress & prostitute, Theodora was a 6th century co-ruler of this empire with her husband Justinian
Cassius & this other Roman betrayer/assassin are in the mouth of Satan
Referred to by Dante as the Scourge of Earth, he attacked the Roman Empire throughout the 5th century
Considering herself the daughter of the sun god Re, this queen can be found with the sexual sinners
He tells Dante that instead of staying home with Penelope, he went off to sea again--glub, glub
Feast on this Greek philosopher who espoused pleasure & physics rather than fear of deities & death
It's about time this double-talk term for flashy & expensive jewelry was added
New in medical terms is this 2-word surgical procedure sometimes called stomach stapling
It can be music or a sound effect, but it lets you know you have an incoming cell-phone call
This word can mean to increase the amount or extent of anything, not just your McDonald's fries
Under "B" you'll find this 9-letter word for a renewable fuel made from vegetable sources like soybean oil

rounds.text: In June 1996 Rev. Njongonkulu Ndungane was named his successor
